workspace.query: declare namespace akn="http://docs.oasis-open.org/legaldocml/ns/akn/3.0"; declare namespace uk="https://caselaw.nationalarchives.gov.uk/akn"; { for $doc in cts:search(fn:doc(), cts:parse("borough")) let $meta := $doc/akn:akomaNtoso/akn:judgment/akn:meta let $decision := $doc/akn:akomaNtoso/akn:judgment/akn:judgmentBody/akn:decision let $uri := fn:document-uri($doc) let $name := $meta/akn:identification/akn:FRBRWork/akn:FRBRname/@value let $date := $meta/akn:identification/akn:FRBRWork/akn:FRBRdate[@name='judgment']/@date let $court := $meta/akn:proprietary/uk:court/text() let $citation := $meta/akn:proprietary/uk:cite/text() (: let $hl := cts:highlight($doc, "borough", {$cts:text}) :) order by $name descending return {$uri} {$name} {$date} {$court} {$citation} {$decision} }

xquery version "1.0-ml";
declare namespace akn="http://docs.oasis-open.org/legaldocml/ns/akn/3.0"; declare namespace uk="https://caselaw.nationalarchives.gov.uk/akn"; import module namespace search = "http://marklogic.com/appservices/search" at "/MarkLogic/appservices/search/search.xqy";
let $options := <options xmlns="http://marklogic.com/appservices/search"> <transform-results apply="snippet"/> <snippet-format>xml</snippet-format> <preferred-matches> <element ns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/legaldocml/ns/akn/3.0" name="p"/> </preferred-matches> <per-match-tokens>30</per-match-tokens> <max-matches>3</max-matches> <highlight/> <term> <term-option>case-insensitive</term-option> (: needs stemmed searching turned on for database :) <term-option>stemmed</term-option> </term> </options>
let $query := "Richard Scott"
return <summaries> { (: Use search:search() instead of cts:search(). It returns a rich <search:response> object containing results with snippets already generated. :) for $result in search:search($query, $options)/search:result let $uri := $result/@uri let $doc := fn:doc($uri) (: Get the full document node using the URI from the result :)
(: Extract metadata just like you did before :) let $meta := $doc/akn:akomaNtoso/akn:judgment/akn:meta let $name := $meta/akn:identification/akn:FRBRWork/akn:FRBRname/@value let $date := $meta/akn:identification/akn:FRBRWork/akn:FRBRdate[@name='judgment']/@date let $court := $meta/akn:proprietary/uk:court/text() let $citation := $meta/akn:proprietary/uk:cite/text()
(: The snippets are directly available in the search result. The highlighting has already been applied based on our options. :) let $snippets := $result/search:snippet
order by $name descending return <summary> <uri>{$uri}</uri> <name>{$name}</name> <judgmentDate>{$date}</judgmentDate> <court>{$court}</court> <citation>{$citation}</citation> { if ($snippets) then <snippets> { for $s in $snippets return <snippet>{$s/search:match/node()}</snippet> } </snippets> else () } </summary> } </summaries>
